DataElement.preferredName: External Gonad Metastasis Anatomic Site Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the anatomic site of the external gonadal metastasis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface._The gamete-producing tissues, ovary or testis. (MeSH)_Metastasis is the spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer. (NCI)_Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.:The part of the reproductive system that produces and releases eggs (ovaries) or sperm (testicles/testes).:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A reproductive system organ that produces and releases either sperm (testis) or eggs (ovary).

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
